metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12652 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
libpng before 1.6.32 does not properly check the length of chunks againstthe user limit.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12652` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpng12-0 - 1.2.54-1ubuntu1.1+esm1
libpng3 - 1.2.54-1ubuntu1.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

firefox - 72.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 72.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 72.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libpng package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.54-1ubuntu1.1+esm1').
libpng1.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
firefox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '72.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:60.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
